channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Temporary traffic lights not going green, 13th June
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights going South never went green this morning. I waited for all other directions to go green 3 times. I had the same problem yesterday morning. Going North they didn’t go green yesterday evening. It’s really poor as there’s no safe way to get around this junction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, London Wall, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress Flytipping, 13th June
item.description:
Mattress has been dumped next door to 66 Mauritius Road on night of 12th June. Grateful if it could be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mauritius Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household waste black bin permanently locked, 13th June
item.description:
Why is the household waste black bin permanently locked now? It’s creating fly tipping and not giving households the provision of a bin for larger items. The bin is outside Cotes House on the corner of Broadley Street and Ashbridge Street. The bin should be unlocked for residents use, as we are paying a portion of our council tax for this facility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Broadley Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering around the local area & on Forburg Road, 13th June
item.description:
The general cleanliness on Forburg Road & surrounding roads are disgusting! The streets are often littered with rubbish that people have just dropped on the pavement, fly tipped or left outside their hones and remains uncollected by the Waste Disposal Team
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed vehicle dangerously obstructing traffic junction, 13th June
item.description:
This car has been blocking the left hand site of the junction from hall place crescent to Bourne road and has been so for almost 8 days. Can this be removed as soon as possible before there is another accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Mead, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The Trees need pruning along the road, 13th June
item.description:
The trees along Forburg Road need pruning around the base of the trees. In some parts the pavement is almost inaccessible because the growth around the base and wheelie bins block the pavements. This is a hazard for people in wheelchairs, the elderly etc
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement trip hazards, 13th June
item.description:
Most of Southover has very uneven pavements with large cracks, uneven surfaces and broken pavers. They are trip hazards, looks like it's been caused from years of neglect and heavy machinery

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southover, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
